pageContext.description:
A half-length portrait of a young woman, facing left in front of a dark green velvet curtain. The woman is wearing a bluish black dress over a white pleated blouse with a high collar. Her brown curly hair is concealed beneath a black hat. She has folded her arms in front of her. In her left hand she holds a single carnation, which has been a symbol of love and honour since the middle ages. This would suggest that this portrait was conceived with a pendant piece, depicting a male portrait and that together they created a double marriage portrait. 
[Görres, cda 2016]

[Musée Anne-de-Beaujeu & Maison Mantin, revised 2015]

pageContext.provenance:
- bought at Boitel, Paris, by Hofer for Göring (50 000 Swiss Francs) 25 November 1942 (les deux hommes changeaient des francs français et des francs suisses)
- in the Göring Collection, Kurfürst (inv. RM 1291) [1] 
- a document in Koblenz records the Munich No. 7147 [2]
- transferred to the Louvre by l'Office des Biens et Intérêts Privés in 1950 
- deposited in the Musée Anne de Beaujeu de Moulins 19 March 1965 (D 65-1-3) [3]

[1] MAEE/ARD/RA/C 149 A 102 : Göring inventory and record in the SED file on the back of a photograph 
[2] Bundesarchiv, BAK B 323/562
[3] SMF, Sous-direction des collections, dossier Récupération
[http://www.culture.gouv.fr/public/mistral/mnrbis_fr?ACTION=RETROUVER&FIELD_98=TOUT&VALUE_98=cranach&NUMBER=11&GRP=0&REQ=%28%28cranach%29%20:TOUT%20%29&USRNAME=nobody&USRPWD=4$4P&SPEC=9&SYN=1&IMLY=&MAX1=1&MAX2=1&MAX3=50&DOM=All]
see also [http://www.dhm.de/datenbank/goering/dhm_goering.php?seite=5&fld_0=RMG00514]
